sub_topic: Calculating the surface area of a cylinder.
message_1: A cylinder has a radius of 5 centimeters and a height of 12 centimeters. What is the surface area of the cylinder? (Give your answer in square centimeters, rounded to 2 decimal places.)
message_2:
The surface area of a cylinder can be calculated using the formula:

Surface Area = 2 * π * r * (r + h)

where r is the radius and h is the height of the cylinder.

In this case, r = 5 cm and h = 12 cm. Plugging these values into the formula, we get:

Surface Area = 2 * π * 5 * (5 + 12)
Surface Area = 2 * π * 5 * 17
Surface Area = 10 * π * 17
Surface Area ≈ 10 * 3.14 * 17
Surface Area ≈ 534.60 square centimeters

So, the surface area of the cylinder is approximately 534.60 square centimeters, rounded to 2 decimal places.
